Study Description: Researchers analyzed electronic health records from 47,000 patients over 10 years to examine the relationship between atrial fibrillation and stroke.

Key Findings.finding: Patients with atrial fibrillation had a 5.2-fold higher stroke risk compared to patients without AF
Stroke risk increased with severity of AF:
Among patients with AF, 18% experienced a stroke during the study period, while only 3.2% of patients without AF had a stroke
AF diagnosis preceded stroke by an average of 2.8 years
Results were consistent across three separate hospital systems in different regions
